data.title: Tesla (TSLA) Falls Short of Achieving Q3 Delivery Target
data.text: Tesla (TSLA) delivers 79,600 Model 3, and 17,400 Model S and X cars in the three months ended September 2019.

data.title: Tesla Delivers Record Number of Vehicles
data.text: In typical fashion, Elon Musk created that seemingly insurmountable hurdle and then attempted to clear it.

data.title: Tesla Acquires Deepscale, Accelerates Towards Road-Ready Robotaxis
data.text: After 11 autopilot engineers left Tesla Inc (NASDAQ: TSLA) in May amid department restructuring, Tesla found itself in need of new software talent.

data.title: Demand for Tesla vehicles in doubt: JMP Securities analyst
data.text: Joseph Osha of JMP Securities just downgraded Tesla's stock as he doubts demand for the cars, and he breaks down his reasons for downgrading with CNBC's "Power Lunch" team.

data.title: Tesla shares slide after record deliveries
data.text: Shares of Tesla are sliding Thursday after record deliveries in the third quarter fell short of investors' expectations.

data.title: Tesla Breaks Down From Key Support After Deliveries Miss
data.text: Shares declined after third quarter deliveries missed expectations, but Model 3 sales remained strong and the cash position has improved.

data.title: Tesla drops 6% as quarterly deliveries underwhelm Wall Street
data.text: Tesla's  stock dropped 6% on Thursday after the electric car maker's quarterly deliveries underwhelmed investors already concerned about slowing revenue growth and ongoing losses.

data.title: Why Tesla Stock Fell Thursday.
data.text: Record quarterly deliveries weren't enough to impress the Street.

data.title: Tesla Courts Electric Car Buyers With Software Upgrade
data.text: This "biggest update ever" enables car owners to summon their vehicles from parking lots.

data.title: Tesla Analysts: While Short Of Expectations, Q3 Delivery Number Is Pretty Good
data.text: Tesla Inc. (NASDAQ: TSLA) overpromised rather than underperformed, sell-side analysts said after its Wednesday deliveries announcement, with several noting the company continues to deliver more vehicles each quarter and is largely keeping its growth story on track.

data.title: ETFs to Watch as Tesla Misses on Q3 Deliveries
data.text: The weak deliveries data has put the spotlight on ETFs having substantial allocation to this luxury carmaker.

data.title: Tesla delivers 97,000 cars in Q3. Here's what it means for the year
data.text: CNBC's Phil LeBeau reports on Tesla's car sales and what it means for the company's guidance for the year.

data.title: Record-Setting Deliveries Not Enough for Tesla Investors
data.text: After markets closed Wednesday, Tesla Inc. (NASDAQ: TSLA) reported that the company delivered approximately 97,000 vehicles in the third quarter, a record high.

data.title: Tesla shares dip after disappointing third-quarter deliveries
data.text: Tesla shares slid 7 percent in early Thursday trades after billionaire Elon Musk’s electric-car maker said deliveries rose less than expected in the third quarter. Total car deliveries came in at a record 97,000 units for the quarter, Tesla said Wednesday.

data.title: Tesla's stock sinks after deliveries report, JMP downgrades on demand concerns
data.text: Shares of Tesla Inc. TSLA, -0.64% sank 4.9% in premarket trading Thursday, after the electric-car maker reported third-quarter deliveries that disappointed investors with high expectations.

data.title: Analyst says for the first time ever he is worried about Tesla demand, downgrades stock
data.text: JMP Securities lowered its rating on Tesla's stock to market perform from market outperform.

data.title: Tesla Falls Short Of Musk’s Whisper Outlook. Loss For The Quarter Looks To Be Larger Than Expected
data.text: Tesla fell a bit short of Musk’s “Tesla has a shot” at 100,000 deliveries for the September quarter. The results indicate that the company will fall far short of analysts EPS expectations for the quarter.

data.title: Tesla's Q3 Deliveries: What You Need to Know
data.text: Deliveries and demand for Tesla's vehicles are both up -- but the stock is down. Here's what investors should know.

data.title: Tesla's Model Y: This Could Be The Company's Most Profitable Vehicle
data.text: The Model Y will have a successful product ramp, resulting in full production capabilities by the end of Q2 2023 at Fremont and 2021 in Shanghai.
